Brief_Description_of_Provision: Firearm possession is prohibited for all people with a felony conviction
No possession of long guns until age 18
Purchase of long guns from licensed dealers and private sellers restricted to age 18 and older
No possession of handguns until age 21
Purchase of handguns from licensed dealers and private sellers restricted to age 21 and older
No possession of long guns until age 21
Purchase of long guns from licensed dealers and private sellers restricted to age 21 and older
Purchase of long guns from licensed dealers restricted to age 21 and older
Firearm possession is prohibited for some people with alcoholism
Firearm possession is prohibited for some people with alcohol-related problems
Purchase of any type of ammunition restricted to age 18 and older
Purchase of handgun ammunition restricted to age 21 and older
Background checks required for ammunition purchase
Vendor license required to sell ammunition
Permit required to purchase ammunition
Records of ammunition sales must be retained
All of the state’s high-risk gun possession prohibitions also apply to ammunition possession
Ban on sale of assault weapons beyond just assault pistols
Ban on sale of assault weapons which includes a list of banned weapons
Grandfathered weapons must be registered
Transfer of grandfathered weapons is prohibited
State can retain background check records for at least 60 days
Criminal liability for negligent storage applies to access by children less than 14 years old
Criminal liability for negligent storage applies to access by children less than 16 years old
Criminal liability for negligent storage applies to access by children less than 18 years old
Criminal liability for negligent storage of guns if child gains access
Criminal liability for negligent storage of guns, regardless of whether child gains access
Criminal liability for negligent storage applies regardless of whether gun is loaded or unloaded
Criminal liability for negligent storage of guns if child uses or carries the gun
Concealed carry permit process requires a background check
Background check process for a concealed carry permit explicitly requires a check of the NICS database
Concealed carry permit renewal requires a new background check
Authorities are required to revoke concealed carry permits under certain circumstances
No gun carrying allowed on college campuses except for concealed weapon permittees
No gun carrying on college campuses, including concealed weapons permittees
Firearm possession is prohibited if person is deemed by court to be a danger to oneself or others
State dealer license required for sale of all firearms
State dealer license required for sale of handguns
De facto registration of firearms is in place because of a recordkeeping requirement for all gun sales
De facto registration of handguns is in place because of a recordkeeping requirement for all handgun sales
Firearm possession is prohibited for people with a drug misdemeanor conviction
State law automatically prohibits domestic violence-related restraining order (DVRO) subjects from possessing firearms
DVROs are automatically prohibiting if the subject is a dating partner of the petitioner
Law enforcement officials are required to remove firearms from people subject to a domestic violence-related restraining order
State law requires DVRO subjects to surrender their firearms
The surrender provisions apply if the subject is a dating partner of the petitioner
No additional finding is required before the firearm surrender provisions apply
No gun carrying on elementary school property, including concealed weapons permittees
Ex parte (temporary) DVRO subjects are automatically prohibited from possessing firearms
Ex parte DVROs are prohibiting if the petitioner is a dating partner of the DVRO subject
State law requires ex parte DVRO subjects to surrender their firearms
The ex parte DVRO surrender provisions apply if the subject is a dating partner of the petitioner
No additional finding is required before the ex parte DVRO firearm surrender provisions apply
Buyers must be fingerprinted at point of purchase
Background checks required for all gun show firearm sales at point of purchase
Background checks required for gun show handgun sales at point of purchase
Family members or law enforcement officers can confiscate firearms from any person who is deemed by a judge to represent a threat to themselves or others
Law enforcement officers can confiscate firearms from any person who is deemed by a judge to represent a threat to themselves or others
No law provides blanket immunity to gun manufacturers or prohibits state or local lawsuits against gun manufacturers
All firearms must be removed from the scene of a domestic violence incident
Mandatory police inspections of dealers
Firearm possession is prohibited for people who have been involuntarily committed to an inpatient facility
Firearm possession is prohibited for people who have been involuntarily committed to an outpatient facility
Ban on junk guns (sometimes called "Saturday night specials")
Dealers are liable for damages resulting from illegal gun sales
Safety lock required for handguns sold through licensed dealers
All firearms in a household must be stored securely (locked away) at all times
Safety lock required for handguns sold through all dealers
Safety lock is required for handguns and must be approved by state standards
Mandatory reporting of lost and stolen guns by firearm owners
Ban on sale large capacity magazines beyond just ammunition for pistols
Possession of pre-owned large capacity magazines is prohibited
"May issue" state
People convicted of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence against a spouse, ex-spouse, or cohabitating partner are prohibited from possessing firearms
All people convicted of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence are prohibited from possessing firearms
State law allows law enforcement to remove firearms from MCDV offenders
State law requires law enforcement officers to remove firearms from MCDV offenders
People convicted of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence against a spouse, ex-spouse, or cohabitating partner are required to surrender their firearms
The surrender provisions apply if the defendant is a dating partner of the victim
People convicted of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence against a spouse, ex-spouse, or cohabitating partner are required to surrender their firearms with no exceptions
Required background checks include an explicit requirement for search of state mental health records
All handguns sold must have either ballistic fingerprinting or microstamping so that they can be identified if used in a crime
No stand your ground law
Ban on sale of assault weapons using a one-feature definition
Buyers can purchase no more than one handgun per month with no or limited exceptions
No open carry of handguns is allowed in public places
No open carry of long guns is allowed in public places
No open carry of handguns is allowed in public places unless the person has a concealed carry or handgun carry permit
No open carry of long guns is allowed in public places unless the person has a permit
A license or permit is required to purchase all firearms
Permit required to carry concealed weapons
A license or permit is required to purchase handguns
Permit process involves law enforcement
State has a law that requires review of personalized gun technology
State law does not preempt local regulation of firearms in any way
State law does not completely preempt local regulation of firearms
Any state law that preempts local regulation of firearms is narrow in its scope (i.e., in one area of regulation)
Dealers can retain sales records for at least 60 days after firearm purchase
All private sellers and licensed dealers are required to keep and retain records of all firearm sales
All private sellers and licensed dealers are required to keep and retain records of handgun sales
Licensed dealers are required to keep and retain records of all firearm sales
Licensed dealers are required to keep and retain records of handgun sales
Gun owners must register their firearms with the state
Gun owners must register their handguns with the state
People are required to relinquish their firearms after they become prohibited from possessing them
All private sellers and licensed dealers are required to report all firearm sales records to the state
All private sellers and licensed dealers are required to report handgun sales records to the state
Licensed dealers are required to report all firearm sales records to the state
Licensed dealers are required to report handgun sales records to the state
Ban on non-commercial dealers
State requires at least one store security precaution for firearm dealers
Applicants are required to make a heightened showing to obtain a concealed carry permit
A stalking conviction is prohibitive for firearm possession
State conducts separate background checks, beyond the federal NICS check, for all firearms
State conducts separate background checks, beyond the federal NICS check, for handguns
No person may purchase a firearm on behalf of another person
No person may purchase a handgun on behalf of another person
No magazines with a capacity of more than 10 rounds of ammunition may be sold
Mandatory reporting of stolen guns by all firearm dealers
Background checks for gun sales or permits have more than a three day period in which they can be completed
No person may purchase a firearm with the intent to re-sell without the buyer going through a background check or having already gone through a background check
No person may purchase a firearm with the intent to re-sell to a person who is prohibited from buying or possessing a firearm
No person may purchase a handgun with the intent to re-sell to a person who is prohibited from buying or possessing a firearm
Safety training or testing required prior to issuing a firearm license or permit
Universal background checks required at point of purchase for all firearms
Universal background check required at point of purchase for handguns
Background checks conducted through permit requirement for all firearm sales (or universal background checks)
Background checks conducted through permit requirement for all handgun sales (or universal background checks)
Firearm possession is prohibited for people who have committed a violent misdemeanor punishable by less than one year of imprisonment
Handgun possession is prohibited for people who have committed a violent misdemeanor punishable by less than one year of imprisonment
Firearm possession is prohibited for people who have committed a violent misdemeanor punishable by more than one year of imprisonment
